Articles by tag: R

This will list all pages with r code.

Cheat sheets for R and Python, At Your Service.

Last modified: Mar 20, 2015

This post contains a running list of cheat sheets that i've found useful for both R-stats and Python.

R: Creating HDF5 Files in the R

Last modified: Nov 18, 2014 Time: 1.0 - 1.5 Hours , Related: RHDF5,

Create a HDF5 in R from scratch! Add groups and datasets. View the files in the HDFviewer.

Working With Temperature Data Collected for Multiple Sites and Stored in HDF5 Format in R

Last modified: Feb 6, 2015 Time: 1.0 - 1.5 Hours , Related: RHDF5, Ggplot,

Explore, extract and visualize temporal temperature data collected from a NEON flux tower from multiple sites and sensors in R. Learn how to extract metadata and how to use nested loops and dplyr to perform more advanced queries and data manipulation.

Raster Data in R - The Basics

Last modified: Feb 18, 2015

This post explains the fundamental principles, functions and metadata that you need to work with raster data in R.

Working With Rasters in R, Python, QGIS and Other Tools

Last modified: Feb 10, 2015

Learn about the key attributes needed to work with raster data in tools like R, Python and QGIS.

Intro to Working with Hyperspectral Remote Sensing Data in HDF5 Format in R

Last modified: Feb 18, 2015 Time: 1.0 - 1.5 Hours , Related: RHDF5, Raster, Rgdal,

Open up and explore a hyperspectral dataset stored in HDF5 format in R. Learn about the power of data slicing in HDF5. Slice our band subsets of the data and create and visualize one band.

Creating a Raster Stack from Hyperspectral Imagery in HDF5 Format in R

Last modified: Feb 9, 2015 Time: 1.0 - 1.5 Hours , Related: RHDF5, Raster,

Open up and explore hyperspectral imagery in HDF format R. Combine multiple bands to create a raster stack. Use these steps to create various band combinations such as RGB, Color-Infrared and False color images.

Activity: Creating A Square Buffer Around a Plot Centroid in R

Last modified: Nov 15, 2014 Time: 1.0 - 1.5 Hours , Related: sp, rgdal,

This activity walks you through creating square polygons from a plot centroid (x,y format) in R.

2014

Interactive Data Viz Using R, GGPLOT2 and PLOTLY

Check out some interactive visualizations using NEON Flux Tower Temperature data created using R and Plotly.

Species Occurence maps

Explore some provisional NEON data that characterizes small mammal abundance and soil N:P ratio data at several NEON sites. Maps created using ESRI ArcGIS online.

Activity: Getting Started with the R Programming Language

This activity will present the basics of using R.

Working With Functions in R

This activity will provide the basics of creating a function in R.

Activity: Installing & Updating Packages in R

This activity provides the basics of installing and working with packaged in R

The Basics of LiDAR - Light Detection and Ranging - Remote Sensing

Last modified: Dec 11, 2014 Time: 0.25 - .5 Hours

Explore the basics of how a LiDAR system works and what a LiDAR system measures.

R: Create a Canopy Height Model from LiDAR derived Rasters (grids) in R

Last modified: Feb 5, 2015 Time: 3.0 - 3.5 Hours , Related: Raster, sp, Dplyr,

Bring LiDAR-derived raster data (DSM and DTM) into R to create a final canopy height model representing the actual vegetation height with the influence of elevation removed. Then compare lidar derived height (CHM) to field measured tree height to estimate uncertainty in lidar estimates.
